articles.headline: Court Sets Deadline for a Volkswagen Diesel Fix, but Solution Could Prove Elusive
articles.snippet: A federal judge’s ruling comes as experts question whether it is even possible for the automaker’s diesel cars to meet air-quality rules.
articles.abstract: A federal judge’s ruling comes as experts question whether it is even possible for the automaker’s diesel cars to meet air-quality rules.
articles.lead_paragraph: Six months after he learned that his Volkswagen-made car violated clean-air rules, Tony German was still waiting to learn what to do about it. After a court ruling on Thursday, he might have to wait even longer.

articles.headline: In Shift to Streaming, Music Business Has Lost Billions
articles.snippet: Streaming and vinyl sales surge, but the big moneymaker, CDs, has been gradually abandoned.
articles.abstract: Streaming and vinyl sales surge, but the big moneymaker, CDs, has been gradually abandoned.
articles.lead_paragraph: There is plenty of good news in the music industry’s latest sales report released this week. Streaming is up. Vinyl has continued its unlikely renaissance. And did we mention that streaming is up?
articles.byline: By Ben Sisario and Karl Russell

articles.headline: Plan to Rescue Puerto Rico Advances, Led by House Republicans
articles.snippet: The plan falls short of permission for the island to restructure its $72 billion debt, and would involve close federal oversight.
articles.abstract: The plan falls short of permission for the island to restructure its $72 billion debt, and would involve close federal oversight.
articles.lead_paragraph: Politicians in Washington are coalescing around a financial plan to rescue Puerto Rico, just weeks before an expected major default on bond payments that would spread more turmoil through the island’s shaky economy.

articles.headline: On Business Issues, Republicans Might Want a Justice Garland
articles.snippet: Merrick Garland’s record as an appeals judge suggests he might be the best Supreme Court nominee Republican senators could hope for.
articles.abstract: Merrick Garland’s record as an appeals judge suggests he might be the best Supreme Court nominee Republican senators could hope for.
articles.lead_paragraph: Memo to the Republican senators who refuse to consider President Obama’s Supreme Court nominee, Merrick Garland: When it comes to business issues, Judge Garland is about as good as you could hope for.

articles.headline: Wisconsin Race Frames Dispute Over Supreme Court Nominee
articles.snippet: A rematch in a Senate contest is playing out as a proxy battle over the appointment of a Supreme Court justice.
articles.abstract: A rematch in a Senate contest is playing out as a proxy battle over the appointment of a Supreme Court justice.
articles.lead_paragraph: PEWAUKEE, Wis. — Senator Ron Johnson, a Tea Party conservative up for re-election in a swing state, looked out at a crowd of supporters and reassured them that he and his fellow Republicans would be resolute in blocking President Obama’s nomination of Judge Merrick B. Garland to the Supreme Court.

articles.headline: Soft and Cuddly? John Kasich’s Old Colleagues Don’t Recognize Him
articles.snippet: Although the Ohio governor presents an aura of civility and kindness, some recall a government career punctuated by confrontations, critiques and undiplomatic remarks.
articles.abstract: Although the Ohio governor presents an aura of civility and kindness, some recall a government career punctuated by confrontations, critiques and undiplomatic remarks.
articles.lead_paragraph: As he tries to halt the momentum of Donald J. Trump, Gov. John Kasich of Ohio tells people they are made special by the Lord. He urges them to invite lonely widows out to dinner. He freely dispenses hugs.
articles.byline: By Thomas Kaplan, Michael Barbaro and Steve Eder

articles.headline: Heroin Epidemic Is Yielding to a Deadlier Cousin: Fentanyl
articles.snippet: Cheaper and far more potent, the synthetic painkiller is becoming the drug of choice for some addicts — and is killing them more quickly.
articles.abstract: Cheaper and far more potent, the synthetic painkiller is becoming the drug of choice for some addicts — and is killing them more quickly.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAWRENCE, Mass. — When Eddie Frasca was shooting up heroin, he occasionally sought out its more potent, lethal cousin, fentanyl.

articles.headline: Medical, Dental, 401(k)? Now Add School Loan Aid to Job Benefits
articles.snippet: Employers like Fidelity have begun instituting student loan repayment benefits, a policy likely to gain traction with American companies.
articles.abstract: Employers like Fidelity have begun instituting student loan repayment benefits, a policy likely to gain traction with American companies.
articles.lead_paragraph: Every month, Amanda Danner and her husband make what feels like a mortgage payment. But they don’t yet own a home.

articles.headline: In Yahoo, Another Example of the Buyback Mirage
articles.snippet: A company’s overall profit growth is unaffected by share buybacks, $6.6 billion since 2008 in Yahoo’s case.
articles.abstract: A company’s overall profit growth is unaffected by share buybacks, $6.6 billion since 2008 in Yahoo’s case.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is one of the great investment conundrums of our time: Why do so many stockholders cheer when a company announces that it’s buying back shares?

articles.headline: A Top ISIS Leader Is Killed in an Airstrike, the Pentagon Says
articles.snippet: The killing of Abd al-Rahman Mustafa al-Qaduli comes as the U.S. appears to be having increased success targeting the Islamic State’s leadership.
articles.abstract: The killing of Abd al-Rahman Mustafa al-Qaduli comes as the U.S. appears to be having increased success targeting the Islamic State’s leadership.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — American Special Operations forces in eastern Syria killed a top Islamic State commander this week, Pentagon officials said Friday, part of a monthslong campaign the Obama administration boasts is eviscerating the Islamic State even as the group continues to demonstrate the power to sow violence in Western Europe.
articles.byline: By Michael S. Schmidt and Mark Mazzetti
